document.docAuthor: Bourdon, Estelle, Amaghzaz, Mbarek & Bouya, Baâdi
document.docTitle: Dasornis toliapica Bourdon & Amaghzaz & Bouya 2010, new combination
document.masterDocTitle: Pseudotoothed Birds (Aves, Odontopterygiformes) from the Early Tertiary of Morocco

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Pseudotoothed Birds (Aves, Odontopterygiformes) from the Early Tertiary of Morocco

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1: Comparative measurements of the cranium in
Dasornis toliapica
and
Dasornis emuinus
. Lengths in mm. * = estimated measurements; ** = strong dorsoventral flattening.

tr.th: Width at rostral end (zona flexoria craniofacialis)
Lamina parasphenoidalis: width at tuberculi basilares
Height of maxilla at apertura nasi ossea
Maximum width of maxilla at apertura nasi ossea

tr.td: 170* (based on BMNH 44096, OCP. DEK/GE 1185 and D1-0027E)

tr.th: Ratio length of maxilla/length of cranium
tr.td: 2/5* (based on estimated length of maxilla and OCP.DEK/GE 1076)

tr.th: Maximum height of mandibula as preserved

subSubSection.paragraph: LOCALITIES: Ouled Abdoun Basin ( Morocco ): Sidi Daoui (including Krupp, PH 2, RP13, TS and TZ5 areas); Recette IV; southern Meraa El Arech (Lahou area); Sidi Chennane (M1S2, M8, M11 and R6–R7 areas).
STRATIGRAPHIC DISTRIBUTION: Bed IIa, Thanetian, Upper Paleocene; intercalary beds II/I, basal Ypresian, lowermost Eocene; bed I, Ypresian, Lower Eocene.

AMENDED DIAGNOSIS (from Harrison and Walker, 1976 ): Albatross-sized odontopterygiform with a wingspan of 2 to 3 m ; differs from
Dasornis emuinus
in the following features: much smaller size; cranium, sutura frontoparietalis less pronounced, forming barely distinguishable groove; lamina parasphenoidalis caudorostrally longer; caudal extension of cotyla quadratica otici shorter and not twisted ventrally; foramen pneumaticum dorsale larger; laterosphenoid hollow square in shape, bounded medially by conspicuous prominentia lobi optici; tibiotarsus with shorter sulcus musculi fibularis.
